title: What do I do after 12th by PCM? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Success is where preparation and opportunity meet together” – Anonymous The very first step after choosing a course is knowing what are the different options available. And this is where one of the most difficult questions to think about i.e. which is the most rewarding career after the completion of the crucial examination. This also becomes a difficult option as there is a myriad of options available these days for students to choose from. In addition, one of the advantageous steak a science student has over a non-science student is the option to opt for courses in Arts as well as Commerce field. However, since you have taken up PCM as your field of study there are a plethora of options available for one to explore further.  PCM stands for Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. Students who had taken PCM in their Class 12th have a myriad of options to decide from. These are as follows: 1. B.E. (Bachelor of Engineering) B.E. which is also popularly known as Bachelors of Engineering is an undergraduate program in engineering conducted for a duration of 4 years. The major fields in the sector include: B.E. in Information TechnologyB.E. in Aerospace EngineeringB.E. in Automobile EngineeringB.E. in Computer Science and TechnologyB.E. in Mechanical EngineeringB.E. in Chemical EngineeringB.E. in Electrical EngineeringB.E. in Civil EngineeringB.E. in Automobile EngineeringB.E. in Telecommunications EngineeringB.E. in Automobile EngineeringB.E. in Mining EngineeringB.E. in Production EngineeringB.E. in Power EngineeringB.E. in Instrumentation EngineeringB.E. in Environmental EngineeringB.E. in Metallurgical EngineeringB.E. in Manufacturing EngineeringB.E. in Mineral EngineeringJob options: B.E. offers a plethora of options for candidates in the capacities of consultants, researchers, subject matter experts, managers, etc. recruited by top companies including TATA Consultancy, Larson & Toubro, IBM Global Services, Accenture Services and much more. 2. B.Tech (Bachelor of Technology) B. Tech also popularly known as Bachelors of Technology is a professional undergraduate program in engineering program which is conducted for a duration of 4 years. The major difference between a B.Tech and BE program is: B. Tech is more skill oriented and leans more towards application engineeringIt deals more with the technical aspects of scienceThe course applies in depth the principles of engineering as well as technology for modifying the structures and thereby enhancing the quality.Typically pursued after 12th, the course is pursued for a duration of 4 years and is for 3 years in case the student pursues Diploma after the completion of 12th. Under B.Tech students can opt for a myriad of specializations which are similar to that of B.E. Job Options: B.Tech being more technically oriented has a larger option in technical fields. Qualified candidates are hired in the capacities of consultants, researchers, subject matter experts, managers, etc. recruited by top companies including TATA Consultancy, Larson & Toubro, IBM Global Services, Accenture Services and much more. 3. Bachelor of Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering Bachelor of Naval Architecture and Ocean Engineering is an undergraduate program which is pursued in a duration of 4 years. A Naval Architect is engineers who deal with the construction, designing and maintenance of marine vessels, oil drilling platforms and much more. They are responsible for formulating safety regulations and damage control for meeting the statutory and non-statutory requirements. Job Options: Qualified students are hired in the capacities of Oceanographers, Ocean Engineers, Naval Architects managing various duties at Offshore Oil Recovery, Marine metals, and corrosion, Environmental Protection, Global Climate Monitoring, Renewable Energy, Underwater Vehicles, etc. 4. Bachelor of Fashion Technology Bachelor of Fashion Technology is an undergraduate program for a duration of 4 years which focuses on the art and science of fashion and design. This course offers insight into the technicalities, methods, and instruments applicable in the production of fashion garments and accessories. Job Options: Able candidates after the completion of the program are rendered job opportunities in wide areas ranging from Textile Designing, Apparel Merchandising, Fashion Designing with an initial remuneration of INR 2 to 6 lacs per annum. 5. B Pharm- Bachelor in Pharmacy B. Pharma is a 4-year undergraduate program that prepares the candidates in becoming able pharmacists. The students are rendered knowledge of modern preparation of medicines and implementing them proper treatment. Job Options: After the completion of the program candidates can fetch a decent salary of around 2 lakh per annum in job profiles of Drug Therapists, Analytical Chemist, Food and Drug Inspector, etc. in top recruiting organization such as Ranbaxy, Zydus, Glenmark, etc. 6. Bachelor in Construction Technology Bachelor in Construction Technology is an undergraduate program conducted for a duration of 4 years. The program covers details about construction materials, site visits and other intricacies included in the field. Job Options: Students after the completion of the program are rendered employment in the areas of Civil Industry, Design and Build Companies, Building Project Management Companies in the capacities of Siding Installer, Remodeller, Deck Builder and much more. 7. BCA- Bachelor of Computer Application Bachelor of Computer Application is a 3-year undergraduate program that renders an in-depth understanding of the basics application techniques in the computer. The course enables students a platform to develop their programming skills and learn application packages. Programming languages and much more. Job Options: Students after the completion of the program are rendered employment in positions of Network Designer, System Manager, Programmer, System Analyst, etc. in top recruiting companies like TCS, HCL, Infosys, Wipro, and much more. 8. B.Sc. in Information Technology (B.Sc. IT) B.Sc. in Information Technology is a 3-year undergraduate program which renders the candidates an in-depth understanding of storing, securing, managing and processing information. Job Options: Students after the completion of the program are rendered employment in positions of Programmers, PHP Developer, Oracle PL/SQL Developer, Quality Analyst, IT Specialists, Technology Engineer in Educational Institutes, Space Research Institutes, Hospitals, Health Care Providers, Pharmaceuticals and Biotechnology Industry, and other such. 9. B.Sc. Geology B.Sc. Geology is a3 years undergraduate program in geology. Students are rendered knowledge of geotechnical engineering as well as the study of Solid Earth and its implications in different fields. Job Options: Students after the completion of the program are rendered employment in positions of Geologist, Researchers, Soil Scientist, Analyst and much more at Geological Survey of India, GSPC, Schlumberger, RIL, etc. With a myriad of opportunities available there are also other professional courses which are non-science that can be opted by the students. Choose Wise, Choose Best to set your Career in Pace.

No one can answer this question for you and if some one try to answer you he is not a competent person. Let me help you why I am saying this. How do you define a good career for yourself? The career which you may like may not be good for someone else and the right career for others may not be good for you. Therefore, this is very subjective and personal choice. This is common problem but we all trust others to advise us for a good course or career. Let’s take an example - How will you react if I advise you to go for B.Tech CS? Or go to US and take a degree in Maths. These are the best career for you. Your conclusion will be I am a big fool and you will be surprise that what kind of career counselor I am. I am very sure that you can find a bright career path for yourself. Just read this carefully - I would advise you to follow a simple process to find out a right career path for yourself. List out your career choices - you may list a large number - list all of them in first attempt.Then find out more information & take a decision on each of them. If required take help of your friend, family members, teachers or any other senior person you have access to. Understand each option and start reducing your list based on your own criteria, information and choice.Contact any career counselor or any other person or site to take personality assessment test to find your personality traits. This will help you matching your personality traits and interest with your choice. This personality test gives you opportunity to identify your own good & not so good personality traits, which you can work on, which will help you all through you life.You can also add any career choice during this process, which you have missed or didn’t like it in your first selection or have come to know about it now.I am sure you will end-up very soon with 2 or 3 choices. Then it will be easy for you to narrow down your final career path.Consider the full profile of a career path or job - not just subject/course or few aspects of a job profile, such as - many of us are impressed by a well dressed Army or police officer. Don’t give undue weightage to earnings in this career selection process. The right career will give you more better life, peace, and pleasure.In case if you are confused in last two or three choices, then gather more information on each of them and then take a final view. Don’t worry this a very common & normal scenario.Don't go by just advice & suggestions, consider your choice first based on your advantage or limitations. Feel free to contact me at any point for help. Hope this helps.
